title: Manifold of Symmetric Positive Definite Matrices — SPDMatrices
code: if (reticulate::py_module_available("geomstats")) {   spdm <- SPDMatrices$new(n = 3)   A <- diag(1, 3)   spdm$belongs(A)   B <- diag(-1, 3)   spdm$belongs(B) }

title: Manifold of Symmetric Positive Definite Matrices — SPDMatrices
text: Compute cholesky factor symmetric positive definite matrix.

title: Manifold of Symmetric Positive Definite Matrices — SPDMatrices
Manifold of Symmetric Positive Definite Matrices — SPDMatrices
text: mat SPD matrix.

title: Manifold of Symmetric Positive Definite Matrices — SPDMatrices
text: Cholesky factor represented numeric vector stores lower triangular matrix including diagonal elements column-major fashion.

title: Manifold of Symmetric Positive Definite Matrices — SPDMatrices
code: if (reticulate::py_module_available("geomstats")) {   spdm <- SPDMatrices$new(n = 3)   V <- cbind(     c(sqrt(2) / 2, -sqrt(2) / 2, 0),     c(sqrt(2) / 2, sqrt(2) / 2, 0),     c(0, 0, 1)   )   A <- V %*% diag(1:3) %*% t(V)   spdm$cholesky_factor(A)  }

title: Manifold of Symmetric Positive Definite Matrices — SPDMatrices
code: ## ------------------------------------------------ ## Method `SPDMatrices$new` ## ------------------------------------------------  if (reticulate::py_module_available("geomstats")) {   spdm <- SPDMatrices$new(n = 3)   spdm }  ## ------------------------------------------------ ## Method `SPDMatrices$belongs` ## ------------------------------------------------  if (reticulate::py_module_available("geomstats")) {   spdm <- SPDMatrices$new(n = 3)   A <- diag(1, 3)   spdm$belongs(A)   B <- diag(-1, 3)   spdm$belongs(B) }  ## ------------------------------------------------ ## Method `SPDMatrices$cholesky_factor` ## ------------------------------------------------  if (reticulate::py_module_available("geomstats")) {   spdm <- SPDMatrices$new(n = 3)   V <- cbind(     c(sqrt(2) / 2, -sqrt(2) / 2, 0),     c(sqrt(2) / 2, sqrt(2) / 2, 0),     c(0, 0, 1)   )   A <- V %*% diag(1:3) %*% t(V)   spdm$cholesky_factor(A)  }
